channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Chris Hughes, Marketcrafters
channel.desc: Facebook co-founder Chris Hughes argues that over the past 100 years, the U.S. government, not the free market, has been responsible for the success of the U.S. economy; he spoke at Politics and Prose Bookstore in Washington, DC.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Former Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden Discusses Her Career & Firing
channel.desc: Former Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden discusses her career, firing by President Trump, and the future of American libraries.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Martin Reeves, Like - The Button That Changed the World
channel.desc: How did the Like button become so ubiquitous? Author Martin Reeves explores the origins of the thumbs-up symbol and how it's changed the internet; Planet Word Museum in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jason Bohm, Washington's Marines
channel.desc: Author and U.S. Marine Corps Maj. Gen. Jason Bohm talks about the origins of the Marine Corps, including strategic decisions that shaped the formation of the Continental Marines in the Revolutionary War.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: Gavel-to-gavel and uninterrupted live coverage of the U.S. Senate from the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.
